comment: Notes and study guides are nothing like the tests. Wouldn't recommend taking his class unless you plan on teaching yourself an entire course.

Professor is a very caring and nice person, but that doesn't take away from the fact that his tests are just plain hard, and I mean unnecessarily hard. I'm good at math in general, so I was shocked to see how badly my test grades have been. The only thing that saved me was my participation and homework, but I still didn't get the grade I wanted.

I've always been a straight-A student, especially in Math, but this class made me question my intelligence...Professor Riley's a nice guy, but his tests are insanely hard and aren't based on the weekly homework we're assigned. Personally, I wouldn't take again, and I STRONGLY advise you to not take him either, especially if you struggle in Math.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Test are harder than what is learned in class cool teacher, but his methods of teaching is not good this is my first year in college and I wished I did rate my professor and took advantage of drop add when I could. I highly recommend not taking this class.

I would love to go in depth on why I didn't like this class but long story short, his tests are very hard and he randomly generates his study guides (I wish this was a joke seriously DO NOT use them if you want a chance a passing, use his OneNote instead). HW was okay just time consuming, good guy and makes jokes but insanely boring lectures.
He cracks jokes but teaches for the entirety of class, so a ton of lecturing. I got an A but I had to really work for it because there's lots of homework and studying involved for this class.

He's a nice guy, but his teaching methods were not for a lot of the class. The final was not covering the main course material we focused on. He did not curve test grades even though almost everyone did bad on the last test. 3 tests, homework every week that you teach yourself how to do. He also takes a long time to respond to emails :(.

Professor Riley or "The Steve" is super cool! He takes a lot of time to try and cover every problem and always makes sure he's not going too fast. There is homework every week, 4 tests (including final). If you do the study guides you'll do great on the tests because they're the same questions! Prof Riley really wants you to succeed!!

Math is definitely not my best subject I usually get a B. This class had a lot of work but I feel like the program ALEKS prepared us for the tests. Some study guides were similar to the test and some tests were easier than the study guide. This class wasn't that bad. Do the homework and you'll be fine. I am taking him again for pre calc :)

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS . ESPECIALLY IF ITS GOING TO BE ONLINE. WORST DESCISION IVE MADE SO FAR. nice and caring professor but the workload is ridiculous and you can do all the work but still fail!!!! for me math has never been easy but Ive still made a's in it up until this class! DONT DO IT

Okay Ill be honest, this class was difficult for no real reason. He cares more about teaching the logical aspect of math, so you cant really depend on your memory. I have always been a just show me exactly how to do it type of person so it was challenging for me to understand the why part. Hes nice guy, just be prepared to stress out.

No EC. So much homework so split it up or don't wait until last minute. In person tests didn't really coincide with the homework and I failed it. Online was exactly like homework. Homework can be extremely difficult. I was always good at math but this class still killed me. Wouldn't recommend for people who struggle with math. Show up to class!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Somehow the tests were very difficult but most of the content was very easy. Homework is tedious and the platform we used didn't go exactly hand-and-hand with the test content. Prof is a nice guy who cares about his students but sticks to what he says and wont give you too much slack.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: 4 people got A's out of 75 students. Final is worth 30% and dropped my grade from a 93 to an 89. Homework and tests are online. There's a homework assignment each week that takes a good bit of time. I took pre calculus last year in high school and still struggled with this class. His teaching style isn't very helpful and his tests were not easy.

DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT take this professor. His kind demeanor doesn't make up for the hard tests and insane workload. You will end up spending 5-10 hrs a week on homework, but it's worth so little that it offers no cushion to your grade. This was the first C I've ever gotten in a class. I regret not dropping this class when I had the chance.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof Riley is probably one of the worst teachers I have experienced in my college career so far. Don't get me wrong, he is a genuinely nice and funny guy who knows what he is talking about, but personally his teaching style (working through examples of problems for the entirety of 90mins with little interaction) is just not for me. Tests are online

Has to be done his way. Work has to be done for anyone to understand (not everyone understands the concepts of calculus ). If you get the right answer without the work he requires, you get the problem wrong. Practice problems in class are not at all the complexity of the test problems. Terrible teaching style.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This class was difficult, but that is to be expected with most math classes. Attendance is not mandatory, but I highly recommend it. Professor is funny, chill and very clear on what he expects. Go over the class notes and the problems in the book to prepare for the tests. I would absolutely take this class again. Do not underestimate study time.

Professor Riley, or 'The Steve' as he often calls himself, is a funny guy, who seems to teach pretty well and enjoy what he teaches. He goes through the notes and does plenty of practice problems during class. The WebAssign homework is frequently a pain, but the tests are relatively mild by comparison.

To be successful in Calc 1 you need to have a good professor and with Professor Riley that is not the case. He does go over the notes with you but rarely goes over any practice problems. When he does, the problems aren't nearly as tough as the ones you see on the test. Highly recommend not taking this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a good, helpful teacher. Works through a lot of problems with class. His tests are harder than homework.

Professor Riley is an amazing professor, but the subject he teaches is not an easy one. He moves very fast, but with the amount of material he has to cover he pretty much has to. He is hilarious, and LOVES his SEC football. He is a no BS professor, so don't expect any late work or extra credit.

Very funny professor but teaches way too fast. Homework is all online and is 20% of your grade so do it. Tests are much harder and different from the homework ( 50% of your grade) and the final exam is 30%. id recommend taking someone else if you are bad at math like me otherwise a lot of people in my class were fine with the way he teaches.
This class was hard, the homework is online, but the tests are a lot harder than the homework. Even if you attend every lecture, you can still fail.
Tests are really hard, he curves them though. If you study hard enough you can pass, but going to class all the time won't help you pass. Attendance isnt mandatory.

Professor Riley is great. He is young, has a sense of humor and is very easy. All of the homework is an easy A because its online with multiple retries. Class isn't mandatory but it makes the tests a breeze because he makes everything more clear. He curves tests and everything is very straight forward. DEFINITELY RECCOMEND

I recommend taking Professor Riley! His class is really easy and he makes the class a lot of fun. He always creates a study guide before his tests and they are basically the same as the his test. His homework is also very simple. Professor Riley is very helpful and is willing to answer any questions after and during class. TAKE HIM!

Sometimes he was a little unclear as to what people were asking when he tried to answer questions, but otherwise he knew his stuff and went very easy on the class. Should get an A unless you don't get math at all...

As a person Mr. Riley is funny & breeze to be around!! As a teacher in regards to Statistics it's no where near the same. Being that this was his first semester doing so should be the last. No student should have to suffer due to a teacher's inadequateness in that subject. Choose someone else for Stats if you want to pass.

In reference to Statistics he needs to rethink ever teaching this course again. There were too many instances that he couldn't give accurate directions about how to solve the many complicated problems, had a project that many of us were confused on when asked he got confused and to remedy most of our worries he would always say "just relax". How?

Professor Riley is very helpful with any questions. He enjoys being in class. He has an upbeat attitude and makes calculus a little less painful (I hate Math). I ended up getting a C because I'm terrible at Math. It's not a reflection of Professor Riley, he was an awesome teacher and awesome guy! Take his class if you can!!
He is VERY eager to teach math. Great teacher. Going to class is not mandatory, but it helps. He gives study guides for every test.

Overall good teacher his teest are a little difficult but its a pretty easy class to pass if you study do your hw and go to class. wll give pop quizzes every now and then so just show up and pay attention you will be good

Mr. Riley is exceptional is teaching methods. If you want to achieve he will help you but if you don't apply yourself . His attendance policy is a pop quiz and he is through in his teachings. You can tell he is a professor who cares :) and he REALLY LOVES MATH and ONLINE MATHBOOK MY MATH LAB SAVE MONEY
Awesome teacher! He will help you so much whenever you need it.  He can be goofy and makes a lot of Scrubs references.  Overall, a really nice guy who wants you to do well.
